description: Shifts 2 places left under binomial transform.
comments: Starting (1, 2, 4, 9, 23,...) = row sums of triangle A153859. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 02 2009Binomial transform of the sequence starting (1, 1, 2, 4, 9,...) = first differences of (1, 2, 4, 9, 13,...); that is, (1, 2, 5, 14, 42, 134, 455, 1642,...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, May 20 2013Row sums of triangle A256161. - _Margaret A. Readdy_, Mar 16 2015RG-words corresponding to set partitions of {1, ..., n} with every even entry appearing exactly once. - _Margaret A. Readdy_, Mar 16 2015
references: Yue Cai and Margaret Readdy, Negative q-Stirling numbers, preprint 2015.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..100
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210.
A. Claesson and T. Mansour, Permutations avoiding a pair of generalized patterns....
formula: G.f.: Sum{k=0..inf, x^(2k)/[prod(m=0..k-1, 1-mx)*prod(m=0..k+1, 1-mx)]}.G.f. A(x) satisfies A(x)=1+x+x^2/(1-x)*A(x/(1-x)). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Nov 28 2011a(n) = A000994(n) + A000995(n). - _Peter Bala_, Jan 27 2015
mathematica: a[0] = a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[Binomial[n-2, k] a[k], {k, 0, n-2}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 24}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Aug 08 2012, after _Ralf Stephan_ *)
prog: a(n)=if(n<2, 1, sum(k=0, n-2, binomial(n-2, k)*a(k))) /* _Ralf Stephan_; Corrected by Manuel Blum, May 22 2010 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Spelling correction by _Jason G. Wurtzel_, Aug 22 2010
